Full Paragraph Text: The business environment was again marked by great uncertainty in 2014. Disruptive socio-economic and political change continued to affect growth in many parts of the world. In the emerging markets, economic volatility worsened as growth rates slowed and currencies weakened. In the developed markets, deflationary pressures and soft consumer demand resulted in a continued challenging trading environment. In the face of such uncertainty it was more important than ever to stay the course and remain loyal to our strategy, driving short-term performance while ensuring we made the right decisions to deliver our long-term goals. We took decisive steps to further our ambition to be the world’s recognised leading Nutrition, Health and Wellness company, trusted by all stakeholders, while again delivering financial results in 2014 that outperformed the market.
claude3.7: Scale Explanations: Environmental and Societal: The text mentions 'disruptive socio-economic and political change', 'emerging markets', 'economic volatility', 'developed markets', and 'deflationary pressures' - all macro-level economic and societal factors.; Organizational: The company (likely Nestlé based on the reference to 'Nutrition, Health and Wellness') is described as responding to these conditions with its strategy and delivering financial results.
claude3.7: Summary: [Environmental and Societal -> Organizational] Macro-economic conditions including market volatility, deflationary pressures, and weak consumer demand directly influenced the company's strategic decisions and performance outcomes.
4o: Scale Explanations: Environmental and Societal: The text mentions socio-economic and political changes affecting global growth, which are societal-level influences.; Organizational: The company is responding to these changes by adjusting its strategy and performance, indicating organizational-level actions.
4o: Summary: [Environmental and Societal -> Organizational] Socio-economic and political changes influenced the company's strategic decisions and performance.

gemini2.5: Summary: [Environmental and Societal -> Organizational -> Inter-Organizational / Sector] Global socio-economic and political changes created an uncertain environment, to which the organization responded by outperforming the market.

Full Paragraph Text: Through continuous innovation and renovation of our food and beverages portfolio we are able to offer people healthier and tastier choices at every stage of their life, at any time of the day. Science-based innovation enables us to enhance the quality of people’s diets, using our knowledge and our research and development capability to make a positive contribution to society. Wherever you are in the world, we have safe, nutritious products to help you care for yourself and your family. A few years ago, we expanded the boundaries of Nutrition, Health and Wellness with the creation of Nestlé Health Science, motivated by the opportunity to forge a major therapeutic role for nutrition in the management of health. In line with this broadened strategy, in 2014 the Board approved the sale of 48.5 million L’Oréal shares to L’Oréal for cancellation. Part of the proceeds were used for the acquisition of the 50% stake in our joint venture Galderma from L’Oréal, bringing our ownership of Galderma to 100%. Galderma formed the foundation of a new Nestlé subsidiary, Nestlé Skin Health. Its goal is to be recognised as the leading company in skin health, offering science-based solutions to protect, nourish and enhance skin, and where needed to treat, correct and restore damaged skin over the course of people’s lives. Nestlé Skin Health provides prescription drugs, self-medication, therapeutic skin care and aesthetic and corrective medicine, allowing us to compete in the growing and promising multi-billion global skincare market. Nestlé Skin Health was further strengthened by the acquisition of the full rights to commercialise several key aesthetic dermatology products in the United States and Canada.
Scale Disagreement: Environmental and Societal, Individual, Inter-Organizational / Sector

claude3.7: Summary: [Organizational -> Individual] Nestlé's organizational innovation and portfolio development directly impacts individuals' health and wellness by providing nutritious and therapeutic products across different life stages.

Full Paragraph Text: These developments ensure that, building on the strong foundations of our food and beverages business and guided increasingly by science, we can further expand our portfolio to provide promising platforms for future growth in line with our strategy of Nutrition, Health and Wellness. At the same time, we continue the drive to ensure our company is organised efficiently and effectively to deliver continuous profitable growth over the long term. With this objective in mind we made some key decisions, adapting our organisational structure to better prepare ourselves today to meet the challenges of tomorrow.

o4_mini: Summary: [Organizational -> Environmental and Societal] The company's restructuring aims to enhance its health-focused offerings, positively impacting societal wellness.

'Challenges of tomorrow' and 'future growth' also refer to external market and societal conditions that the organization aims to address and thrive within.
gemini2.5: Summary: [Environmental and Societal -> Organizational] Societal trends related to nutrition, health, and wellness, along with future environmental challenges, are driving the company's strategy, portfolio expansion, and organizational restructuring.

Full Paragraph Text: While our company continues to benefit from its decentralised structure, allowing key decisions to be made as close as possible to consumers, there is still an important opportunity to better leverage our scale. That is why in 2014 we set up Nestlé Business Excellence at Executive Board Level, combining GLOBE (Nestlé’s Global Business Excellence function) with Nestlé Business Services (our shared operation for transactional services around the world) and Nestlé Con tinuous Excellence (our continuous improvement and LEAN programme). Through a focus on three areas: Simplifying, Standardising and Sharing, Nestlé Business Excellence will allow us to decrease structural costs and operational expenses, freeing up resources to support growth. This will also allow our markets to keep a sharp focus on generating demand.
claude3.7: Scale Explanations: Organizational: Nestlé as a single company is making internal structural changes by establishing Nestlé Business Excellence at the Executive Board Level.; Inter-Organizational / Sector: The text mentions leveraging 'scale' and references to 'shared operation for transactional services around the world' which indicates cross-organizational operations within Nestlé's global network.
claude3.7: Summary: [Organizational -> Inter-Organizational / Sector] Nestlé's organizational decision to establish Business Excellence at the Executive Board level directly affects how its global network of operations functions by simplifying, standardizing and sharing resources across its worldwide markets.
4o: Scale Explanations: Organizational: The text discusses Nestlé's internal structure and decision-making processes.; Inter-Organizational / Sector: The mention of Nestlé Business Excellence and its global functions implies coordination across multiple organizational units and potentially across the sector.
4o: Summary: [Organizational -> Inter-Organizational / Sector] Nestlé's establishment of Business Excellence aims to leverage organizational scale to improve efficiency and support growth across its global operations.

gemini2.5: Summary: [Organizational -> Individual] A company's decentralized structure allows key decisions to be made as close as possible to consumers.

This balances the different consumer dynamics and opportunities in each geography. Additionally it allows a sharper focus in Zone Asia, Oceania and Africa, a fast-growing part

Full Paragraph Text: The new Nestlé Business Excellence function is led by Chris Johnson, the former head of Zone Americas. Zone Americas is now led by Laurent Freixe, the former head of Zone Europe, and the new Zone EMENA by Luis Cantarell, who previously was in charge of Nestlé Nutrition and Nestlé Health Science. The new head of Nestlé Nutrition is Heiko Schipper, who was formerly responsible for our Global Infant Nutrition division. Nestlé Health Science is led by Greg Behar, who joined the company from Boehringer Ingelheim in July. The newly established Nestlé Skin Health is led by Humberto Antunes, former ly the Chief Executive Officer of our joint venture Galderma.
claude3.7: Summary: N/A

Full Paragraph Text: We further reinforced our business through continued active portfolio management, reviewing the performance of different products in different markets to assess strate gic fit, the extent to which they were accretive against our financial targets, and what investments were necessary to deliver growth. We made choices about where we wanted to invest, where we wanted to improve, and what we wanted to divest. Making such choices enables us to align our resourc es behind our best ideas, products and categories, to deliver sustained financial performance and help us on our journey to recognised Nutrition, Health and Wellness leadership over the short term and the long term.

Full Paragraph Text: We also announced new investments and research collaborations, which will enhance our ability to deliver sci ence-based solutions to improve the quality of people’s lives. A newly-announced research partnership with the EpiGen consortium will help us to better develop our understanding of the influence of nutrition and genetics at the beginning of life and continue to build our knowledge in this important area. The Nestlé Institute of Health Sciences began a collab oration on a groundbreaking project, which could one day lead to the development of made-to-measure vitamin com binations tailored to individual needs. Our company was founded almost 150 years ago on the product Henri Nestlé invented, farine lactée. It saved the life of a child. Today we continue to invest in science-based innovation to ensure we can answer current and future needs.

claude3.7: Summary: [Organizational -> Individual] Nestlé's organizational research investments and collaborations aim to develop personalized nutrition solutions that will directly impact individual health outcomes.

Full Paragraph Text: It is our fundamental belief that to be successful over time we need to create value for our shareholders while at the same time creating value for society. We call this Creating Shared Value. To prosper we have to take a long-term view, framed in a robust set of principles and values that are based on respect: respect for people, respect for the environment, and respect for the world we live in. What we do and the effects of what we do are highly visible. It is our responsibility to connect with different stakeholders, to show transparency and build trust. We have therefore again in 2014 reported on our social performance and our compliance in our Nestlé in society report, and our progress towards meeting the tough targets we set ourselves.
claude3.7: Summary: N/A

4o: Summary: [Organizational -> Environmental and Societal] Nestlé aims to create shared value by aligning its business practices with societal and environmental goals.
o4_mini: Scale Explanations: Organizational: The statement reflects the values and principles of Nestlé as an organization.; Environmental and Societal: The focus on creating value for society indicates an interaction with societal-level systems.

Full Paragraph Text: In 2014 we held another successful Creating Shared Value forum, this time at the Nestlé Research Center in Lausanne, co-organised for the first time with a United Nations body, the UN Conference on Trade and Development (UNCTAD). The President of the Swiss Confederation used his address to the event to plead for water to become a self-standing goal of the future global development agenda. At the event we renewed our long-standing partnership with the International Federation of Red Cross and Red Crescent Societies. Since 2006 this collaboration has focused on the improvement of rural communities’ access to clean water and sanitation.
claude3.7: Scales: Environmental and Societal, Inter-Organizational / Sector, Organizational
claude3.7: Scale Explanations: Organizational: Nestlé as a single company and the Nestlé Research Center; UNCTAD as a single UN body.; Inter-Organizational / Sector: The partnership between Nestlé and the International Federation of Red Cross and Red Crescent Societies represents a formal collaboration between multiple organizations.; Environmental and Societal: Rural communities represent societal groups; the Swiss Confederation represents a government entity.
claude3.7: Summary: [Inter-Organizational / Sector -> Environmental and Societal] The partnership between Nestlé and the International Federation of Red Cross and Red Crescent Societies has focused on improving rural communities' access to clean water and sanitation since 2006.

Full Paragraph Text: Currently, at the United Nations there are intense discussions about the global development goals for the period after 2015. At the same time, governments and international organ isations are increasingly reliant on the expertise, experience and resources of the private sector to help address some of the world’s most pressing problems. This offers an opportunity for global companies such as Nestlé to make a valu able contribution, in partnership with governments and civil society. We are participating actively in the policy dialogue in areas which will deeply influence our future business, such as food security, nutrition and health, water, sustainability, and human rights.

gemini2.5: Scale Explanations: Environmental and Societal: Includes 'United Nations' (as a global system actor in discussions), 'governments', 'international organisations' (acting at a macro-level), 'civil society', 'global development goals', 'policy dialogue', and societal problems like 'food security, nutrition and health, water, sustainability, and human rights'. These represent societal-level systems and concerns.; Inter-Organizational / Sector: Refers to the 'private sector' as a collective group of organizations, representing an industry or economic sector that governments increasingly rely upon.; Organizational: Refers to a specific 'global company such as Nestlé' and its 'future business', representing a single organizational entity.
gemini2.5: Summary: [Environmental and Societal -> Inter-Organizational / Sector -> Organizational <-> Environmental and Societal] Governments and international organizations at the societal level rely on the private sector, creating opportunities for global companies like Nestlé to actively participate in and be influenced by societal policy dialogue concerning global development goals.

Full Paragraph Text: Our success has always been based upon our determination to stay the course and look ahead, to understand the environment in which we operate, to organise ourselves to seize opportunities to deliver profitable growth, now and in the future. Although we are operating in a challenging and turbulent economic environment, we see these as fascinating times, full of opportunities. We continue to commit ourselves to ambitious financial targets. We aim to achieve organic growth of around 5% to 6%, improvements in margins and underlying earnings per share in constant currencies, as well as capital efficiency. There will be years when we exceed our ambition and years where we come close, but this is the line we want to walk over time.
claude3.7: Summary: N/A
4o: Summary: N/A
o4_mini: Summary: N/A
gemini2.5: Scale Explanations: Organizational: The text refers to 'we' and 'our success,' describing an entity (a company or organization) that sets financial targets, aims for organic growth, and organizes itself.; Environmental and Societal: The 'challenging and turbulent economic environment' represents a societal-level system (capital markets, economic conditions) that impacts the organization.
gemini2.5: Summary: [Organizational <-> Environmental and Societal] An organization operates within a challenging economic environment, aiming to understand it and adapt its operations to achieve profitable growth.

Full Paragraph Text: We would like to thank our 339000 employees, whose com mitment to Nestlé, hard work and disciplined alignment behind our strategy ensured that we achieved our common goals. Their talent, their creativity, their discipline and entrepreneurship are key to delivering our results. We would also like to thank you, our shareholders, for your investment and your confidence, which have enabled us to deliver good returns for investors over the long term.
claude3.7: Summary: N/A
4o: Scale Explanations: Individual: The employees of Nestlé are specific individuals contributing to the company's success.; Organizational: Nestlé as a company represents the organizational scale, benefiting from the employees' efforts.
4o: Summary: [Individual -> Organizational] The commitment and hard work of Nestlé employees directly contribute to the company's achievement of its goals.
o4_mini: Scale Explanations: Individual: The employees of Nestlé are recognized for their commitment and hard work.; Organizational: Nestlé as an organization is highlighted for achieving common goals through its employees.; Inter-Organizational / Sector: Shareholders are acknowledged for their investment, which impacts the organization's performance and returns.
o4_mini: Summary: [Individual, Inter-Organizational / Sector -> Organizational] The commitment of employees and the investment from shareholders collectively contribute to Nestlé's success.
gemini2.5: Scale Explanations: Individual: Refers to 'employees' and 'shareholders', specific individuals or informal groups whose actions (commitment, hard work, disciplined alignment, investment, confidence) directly influence the company.; Organizational: Refers to 'Nestlé' as a single company, its 'strategy', 'common goals', and 'results', which are influenced by individuals and in turn provides returns to shareholders.
gemini2.5: Summary: [Individual -> Organizational; Organizational -> Individual] The commitment and investment from employees and shareholders directly enable Nestlé's organizational achievements, leading to good returns delivered back to shareholders.

Full Paragraph Text: For almost 150 years we have enhanced people’s lives by offer ing tastier and healthier food and beverages choices at all stages of life and at any time of day, helping them care for themselves and their families. We have built our success by anticipating the future and continuously adapting ourselves to seize the opportunities it presents.
claude3.7: Summary: N/A
4o: Summary: N/A
o4_mini: Summary: N/A
gemini2.5: Scale Explanations: Organizational: The pronoun 'we' refers to a single company or organization that has been operating for 150 years and offers products.; Individual: Refers to 'people's lives', 'themselves', and 'their families' who are the recipients of the organization's products and whose lives are enhanced.
gemini2.5: Summary: [Organizational -> Individual] A company enhances people's lives by offering healthier food and beverage choices.

Full Paragraph Text: Through the continuous innovation and renovation of our pro ducts we are helping people enjoy healthier diets. In 2014 we continued to invest behind the ideas, the products and the categories that help us on our journey towards recognised Nutrition, Health and Wellness leadership, and deliver sustained financial performance.
claude3.7: Scale Explanations: Organizational: The company ('we') that is innovating products and making investments in 2014.; Individual: The 'people' who are helped to 'enjoy healthier diets' through the company's product innovations.
claude3.7: Summary: [Organizational -> Individual] A company's continuous product innovation and renovation directly influences individuals' ability to enjoy healthier diets.
4o: Scale Explanations: Organizational: The company is investing in product innovation and renovation.; Individual: People are enjoying healthier diets as a result of the company's products.
4o: Summary: [Organizational -> Individual] The company's product innovations help individuals enjoy healthier diets.

gemini2.5: Summary: [Organizational -> Individual AND Organizational -> Environmental and Societal] The company's continuous innovation and investment directly enable individuals to enjoy healthier diets, and these actions also contribute to its recognized leadership and financial performance within the broader societal and market contexts.

Full Paragraph Text: Our ambition is not just to be the leader but the industry refer ence for Nutrition, Health and Wellness. In recent years we have built on the strong foundations of our unrivalled food and bev erage portfolio, exploring the benefits of nutrition’s therapeutic role with Nestlé Health Science. In 2014 we again expanded the boundaries of Nutrition, Health and Wellness with the creation of Nestlé Skin Health, offering scientifically-proven products and solutions for people’s skin health needs throughout their lives.
Scale Disagreement: Environmental and Societal, Individual, Inter-Organizational / Sector
claude3.7: Summary: N/A
4o: Scale Explanations: Organizational: Nestlé as a company is expanding its portfolio and creating new divisions.; Inter-Organizational / Sector: The expansion into Nutrition, Health, and Wellness positions Nestlé as a reference point in the industry, influencing sector standards.
4o: Summary: [Organizational -> Inter-Organizational / Sector] Nestlé's expansion into health science and skin health aims to set industry standards in Nutrition, Health, and Wellness.
o4_mini: Scale Explanations: Organizational: Nestlé is a single organization that is expanding its portfolio and influence in the health and wellness sector.; Environmental and Societal: The initiatives by Nestlé in nutrition and health have broader implications for societal health and wellness.
o4_mini: Summary: [Organizational -> Environmental and Societal] Nestlé's expansion into health and wellness influences societal health standards and practices.
gemini2.5: Scale Explanations: Organizational: The text describes Nestlé, Nestlé Health Science, and Nestlé Skin Health, all of which are single organizations or their internal units.; Individual: The phrase 'people’s skin health needs throughout their lives' refers to the specific needs of individuals.
gemini2.5: Summary: [Organizational -> Individual] Nestlé, through its unit Nestlé Skin Health, offers scientifically-proven products and solutions to meet individuals' skin health needs.

Full Paragraph Text: In the following pages we highlight some of our efforts to con tribute to society, driven by our determination to offer Nutrition, Health and Wellness for all.

Full Paragraph Text: Nutrition, Health and Wellness is a priority for the people who buy our products, for society as a whole and for us as a busi ness. As the world’s leading food and beverage company we have a responsibility to use our knowledge and our research and development capability to make a positive difference to society. We have an important role to play in not only provid ing good nutrition but in helping people understand its value.
claude3.7: Summary: N/A
4o: Scale Explanations: Individual: The people who buy the products are individuals concerned with nutrition, health, and wellness.; Organizational: The company, as a business, is responsible for using its knowledge and R&D capabilities.; Environmental and Societal: Society as a whole benefits from improved nutrition and understanding of its value.
4o: Summary: [Individual, Organizational -> Environmental and Societal] The company's efforts in nutrition and wellness influence societal health and understanding.
o4_mini: Scale Explanations: Individual: Consumers prioritize nutrition and wellness, influencing their purchasing decisions.; Organizational: The company, as a leading food and beverage entity, focuses on nutrition and wellness in its product offerings.; Environmental and Societal: The company's efforts in nutrition and wellness contribute to societal health and well-being.
o4_mini: Summary: [Individual, Organizational -> Environmental and Societal] Consumers' focus on nutrition and the company's initiatives collectively enhance societal health.
gemini2.5: Causal Pathway: [Individual, Environmental and Societal] -> Organizational -> [Individual, Environmental and Societal]
gemini2.5: Scale Explanations: Individual: Refers to 'the people who buy our products', which are specific individuals (customers) whose priorities influence the business.; Organizational: Refers to 'us as a business' and 'the world’s leading food and beverage company', representing the single corporate entity and its actions.; Environmental and Societal: Refers to 'society as a whole', indicating a broad societal-level system that influences the business and is subsequently impacted by it.
gemini2.5: Summary: [Individual, Environmental and Societal] -> Organizational -> [Individual, Environmental and Societal] The company's (Organizational) priorities are shaped by the needs of its individual customers and society, which in turn drives the company to act responsibly by making a positive difference to society and helping individuals understand nutrition's value.

Full Paragraph Text: Start Healthy Stay Healthy is our interactive, science-based education programme designed to help parents and care givers provide nutritionally and developmentally adequate nutrition in the crucial first 1000 days of life. We support and promote breastfeeding as the best start a baby can have in life. Our educational programmes are targeted at people who are most involved in implementing good practices during this important early period in a child’s development. We help to guide parents and caregivers to raise healthier children and help healthcare professionals have a greater impact on the nutritional aspects of care of future generations.
claude3.7: Scale Explanations: Organizational: The 'Start Healthy Stay Healthy' program is an organizational entity (likely a company's educational initiative) that is implementing the educational program.; Individual: Parents, caregivers, and healthcare professionals are individuals who are targeted by and influenced by the program.
claude3.7: Summary: [Organizational -> Individual] An educational program designed by an organization directly influences the nutritional practices and knowledge of individual parents, caregivers, and healthcare professionals during the first 1000 days of a child's life.
4o: Scale Explanations: Individual: Parents and caregivers are individuals directly involved in child-rearing practices.; Organizational: The educational programme is an organized initiative designed to influence child nutrition and development.
4o: Summary: [Organizational -> Individual] The educational programme guides parents and caregivers to improve child nutrition and development practices.
o4_mini: Scale Explanations: Individual: Parents and caregivers are directly involved in implementing nutrition practices.; Organizational: The program itself is an organized initiative aimed at educating and supporting caregivers.; Environmental and Societal: The initiative aims to influence societal health outcomes by promoting better nutrition practices.
o4_mini: Summary: [Individual -> Organizational -> Environmental and Societal] The education program empowers parents and caregivers to improve child nutrition, which contributes to better societal health outcomes.
gemini2.5: Scale Explanations: Organizational: The 'Start Healthy Stay Healthy' program, presented as 'our interactive, science-based education programme', represents an initiative from a single organization (implied by 'our').; Individual: Specific individuals are targeted: 'parents and care givers' and 'healthcare professionals', who are directly influenced by the program and then guide 'children' (also individuals).; Environmental and Societal: The long-term goal of the program is to impact 'future generations' by raising 'healthier children', indicating a societal-level outcome beyond individual impact.
gemini2.5: Summary: [Organizational -> Individual -> Environmental and Societal] An organizational education program influences individuals (parents, caregivers, healthcare professionals) to improve nutrition and development, leading to healthier future generations at a societal level.

Full Paragraph Text: We continue to reinforce our leadership in the area of chil dren’s nutrition. By the end of 2014 98% of all our products for children met the Nestlé Nutritional Foundation criteria for children. These criteria are based on nutrition science and public health dietary recommendations from bodies such as the World Health Organization and the Institute of Medicine. Our products are evaluated against these criteria using the Nestlé Nutritional Profiling System which determines their nutritional value and whether they achieve Nestlé Nutritional Foundation status.
claude3.7: Scale Explanations: Organizational: Nestlé as a company with its Nutritional Foundation criteria and Nutritional Profiling System.; Environmental and Societal: World Health Organization and Institute of Medicine as macro-level institutions that provide public health dietary recommendations.
claude3.7: Summary: [Environmental and Societal -> Organizational] Recommendations from societal-level health institutions (WHO, Institute of Medicine) directly shape Nestlé's organizational nutritional criteria and product evaluation systems.
4o: Scale Explanations: Organizational: Nestlé as a company is implementing nutritional criteria for its products.; Environmental and Societal: The criteria are based on public health dietary recommendations from global bodies like the World Health Organization.
4o: Summary: [Organizational -> Environmental and Societal] Nestlé's adherence to nutritional criteria influences public health standards.
o4_mini: Scale Explanations: Organizational: Nestlé, as an organization, is implementing nutritional criteria for its products.; Environmental and Societal: The criteria are based on public health dietary recommendations from global health organizations like the WHO.
o4_mini: Summary: [Organizational -> Environmental and Societal] Nestlé's adherence to public health dietary recommendations shapes its children's nutrition products.
gemini2.5: Scale Explanations: Organizational: Nestlé (referred to as 'We' and 'Our products') is a single organization with internal criteria and systems ('Nestlé Nutritional Foundation criteria', 'Nestlé Nutritional Profiling System').; Environmental and Societal: The 'World Health Organization' and 'Institute of Medicine' are high-level governmental/societal bodies that provide 'public health dietary recommendations', representing a societal-level influence.
gemini2.5: Summary: [Environmental and Societal -> Organizational] Nestlé's internal nutritional criteria for children's products are based on public health dietary recommendations from societal-level bodies like the World Health Organization.

Full Paragraph Text: We are carrying out large-scale studies together with lead ing scientists of children’s diet and lifestyles, based on the success of the Nestlé Feeding Infants and Toddlers Study. In addition to dietary intakes and behaviours, our research explores family dynamics around diets and key lifestyle patterns of children while documenting their height and weight. We use this data to support our product reformulation, consumer communication and educational programmes, and we share the results with the wider scientific community, non-governmental organisations and others.
claude3.7: Causal Pathway: Individual -> Organizational -> Environmental and Societal -> Organizational
claude3.7: Scale Explanations: Organizational: Nestlé is conducting research studies and using the data to inform their product development and communications.; Individual: Children and families are the subjects of the research, with their diets, behaviors, and family dynamics being studied.; Environmental and Societal: The wider scientific community and NGOs represent the societal scale to which Nestlé shares their research findings.
claude3.7: Summary: [Individual -> Organizational -> Environmental and Societal -> Organizational] Nestlé collects data from individual children and families, uses it to reformulate products and create programs, shares findings with the scientific community and NGOs, which likely influences their future organizational strategies.
4o: Scale Explanations: Individual: The study focuses on children's diet and lifestyle, which are individual-level factors.; Organizational: Nestlé is conducting the study and using the data for product reformulation and communication.; Inter-Organizational / Sector: The results are shared with the wider scientific community and NGOs, indicating a sector-level influence.
4o: Summary: [Individual -> Organizational -> Inter-Organizational / Sector] Children's diet and lifestyle data influence Nestlé's product strategies, which are then shared with the scientific community and NGOs.

'Leading scientists' are also specific individuals collaborating on the research.; Organizational: Identified by 'Nestlé,' a single company conducting research, implementing programs (product reformulation, consumer communication, educational programmes), and disseminating results.; Inter-Organizational / Sector: Includes 'wider scientific community' and 'non-governmental organisations,' which are groups of organizations or entities within a specific sector.
gemini2.5: Summary: [[Organizational, Individual] -> Individual -> Organizational -> Inter-Organizational / Sector] Nestlé, in collaboration with leading scientists, conducts studies on individual children's diets and lifestyles, uses this individual-level data to inform its organizational programs, and then shares the results with inter-organizational scientific communities and NGOs.

Full Paragraph Text: We ensure global compliance with responsible advertising and marketing standards for children, abiding by external pledges such as the EU Pledge. At the end of 2014, the Ex ecutive Board approved an updated and strengthened Nestlé Marketing Communication to Children Policy, which will come into effect in December 2015. To ensure consistent and effective implementation, detailed internal guidelines have been developed and external stakeholders are encouraged to provide feedback via our Tell us reporting mechanism. We have phased out our marketing communication in schools and reinforced our health and wellness education activities, particularly those that positively impact children’s development and support governments’ goals to increase physical activity.
claude3.7: Scale Explanations: Organizational: Nestlé as a company implementing its own marketing policies and guidelines, with Executive Board approval of updated policies.; Environmental and Societal: External regulatory frameworks like the EU Pledge, government goals for physical activity, and broader societal standards for responsible advertising to children.
claude3.7: Summary: [Environmental and Societal <-> Organizational] Nestlé adapts its organizational marketing policies in response to societal standards and regulatory frameworks like the EU Pledge, while simultaneously supporting government goals through its health and wellness education activities.
4o: Scale Explanations: Organizational: Nestlé, as a company, is implementing policies and guidelines.; Environmental and Societal: The policies and activities are designed to support societal goals, such as children's development and government physical activity initiatives.
4o: Summary: [Organizational -> Environmental and Societal] Nestlé's updated marketing policy aims to support societal goals for children's development and physical activity.
o4_mini: Scale Explanations: Organizational: Nestlé, as an organization, is implementing policies and guidelines for responsible advertising to children.; Environmental and Societal: The policies aim to align with societal goals, such as increasing children's physical activity and health.
o4_mini: Summary: [Organizational -> Environmental and Societal] Nestlé's updated marketing policy aims to support societal goals for children's health and wellness.
gemini2.5: Scales: Environmental and Societal, Inter-Organizational / Sector, Organizational
gemini2.5: Causal Pathway: ([Inter-Organizational / Sector, Environmental and Societal] -> Organizational) -> Environmental and Societal -> Organizational
gemini2.5: Scale Explanations: Organizational: Refers to Nestlé, a single company, its internal Executive Board, and its internal policies and guidelines (e.g., 'Nestlé Marketing Communication to Children Policy').; Inter-Organizational / Sector: Identified through 'external pledges such as the EU Pledge,' which represents an agreement or standard set by a group of organizations or an industry alliance.; Environmental and Societal: Includes societal-level systems like 'governments’ goals,' broad societal norms and regulations ('global compliance with responsible advertising and marketing standards for children'), the well-being of a community ('children’s development'), and broader public/community entities described as 'external stakeholders.'
gemini2.5: Summary: [([Inter-Organizational / Sector, Environmental and Societal] -> Organizational) -> Environmental and Societal -> Organizational] Nestlé (Organizational) updates its policies and actions, influenced by inter-organizational pledges and broader societal standards, to support governments' goals and children's development, while also receiving feedback from external stakeholders.

Full Paragraph Text: By the end of 2014 the Nestlé Healthy Kids programme was in 73 countries, supporting initiatives which demonstrate how appropriate nutrition and exercise can improve the health of children and their communities. In addition, our own studies in four countries have shown that two thirds of children are insufficiently hydrated when they arrive at school. In 2014 we provided tools and information that schools, parents and caregivers need to ensure children learn about the benefits of healthy hydration.
claude3.7: Scale Explanations: Organizational: Nestlé as a company implementing the Healthy Kids programme; schools receiving tools and information; Individual: Children whose health is being targeted for improvement; parents and caregivers receiving information; Environmental and Societal: Communities that benefit from improved child health
claude3.7: Summary: [Organizational -> Individual] Nestlé's Healthy Kids programme provides nutrition and exercise information to improve children's health, with additional focus on hydration education for schools, parents and caregivers.
4o: Scale Explanations: Organizational: Nestlé, as a company, is implementing the Healthy Kids programme.; Environmental and Societal: The programme aims to improve the health of children and their communities, which is a societal-level impact.
4o: Summary: [Organizational -> Environmental and Societal] Nestlé's Healthy Kids programme aims to improve children's health and community well-being through nutrition and exercise initiatives.
o4_mini: Scale Explanations: Organizational: The Nestlé Healthy Kids programme is an initiative by Nestlé, an organization focused on improving children's health.; Environmental and Societal: The programme impacts societal health by promoting nutrition and hydration in communities and schools.
o4_mini: Summary: [Organizational -> Environmental and Societal] The Nestlé Healthy Kids programme enhances community health by providing resources for better nutrition and hydration in schools.
gemini2.5: Scale Explanations: Individual: Refers to 'children', 'parents', and 'caregivers' who are specific individuals or informal groups being influenced by or studied within the program (e.g., 'children are insufficiently hydrated', 'ensure children learn').; Organizational: Refers to 'Nestlé' (via 'Nestlé Healthy Kids programme', 'our own studies', 'we provided tools') acting as a single organization implementing programs and conducting research.; Environmental and Societal: Refers to 'communities' as societal-level systems and 'schools' as formal public institutions within a community that serve as channels for the program's reach and impact.
gemini2.5: Summary: [Individual -> Organizational -> [Individual, Environmental and Societal]] The observation of individual children's hydration issues by Nestlé led to organizational programs that educate children and engage schools and communities.

Full Paragraph Text: United for Healthier Kids is a platform, created by Nestlé in 2014, where society can engage and collaborate to find ways to improve the health and wellness of children, from conception to the age of 12 years. In Mexico, a TV series was launched which supports and encourages five families looking to change their eating and lifestyle habits over six months. The platform has also been launched in the Philippines.
claude3.7: Scale Explanations: Organizational: Nestlé created the United for Healthier Kids platform as a corporate initiative.; Environmental and Societal: Society is explicitly mentioned as engaging with the platform to improve children's health at a broader societal level.; Individual: Five specific families are participating in the TV series to change their eating and lifestyle habits.
claude3.7: Summary: [Organizational -> Individual] Nestlé's United for Healthier Kids platform directly influences individual families' health behaviors through a TV series that supports five families in changing their eating and lifestyle habits.
4o: Scale Explanations: Organizational: Nestlé, as a company, created the United for Healthier Kids platform.; Individual: The TV series focuses on five families, representing individual units, changing their habits.; Environmental and Societal: The platform aims to improve societal health and wellness of children.
4o: Summary: [Organizational -> Individual -> Environmental and Societal] Nestlé's platform encourages families to adopt healthier habits, aiming to improve children's health at a societal level.
o4_mini: Scale Explanations: Organizational: Nestlé created the United for Healthier Kids platform to promote health and wellness.; Individual: The TV series engages individual families to change their eating and lifestyle habits.; Environmental and Societal: The initiative aims to improve societal health outcomes for children.
o4_mini: Summary: [Organizational -> Individual -> Environmental and Societal] Nestlé's platform encourages families to adopt healthier habits, aiming to enhance children's health in society.
gemini2.5: Scale Explanations: Organizational: Nestlé is a single organization, and 'United for Healthier Kids' is a platform created and managed by this organization.; Environmental and Societal: 'Society' is a societal-level system, and the mention of 'Mexico' and 'Philippines' implies engagement within national societal contexts.; Individual: Specific 'children' and 'five families' are examples of individuals or informal groups whose health and habits are being directly influenced.
gemini2.5: Summary: [Organizational -> Environmental and Societal -> Individual] Nestlé's 'United for Healthier Kids' platform engages society to improve the health and wellness of children and families.

Full Paragraph Text: Through innovation and renovation we continue to make our products tastier and healthier. In line with the recommendations from public health authorities, we are reducing the amount of salt, sugar and saturated fats in our products as part of our contribution towards the fight against non-communicable diseases in society. Our reduction targets are in cluded in our public nutrition commitments (detailed in the Nestlé in society report) so our progress can be measured. We are also ensuring that whole grains are the primary ingredient in our breakfast cereals for children and teenagers.
claude3.7: Scale Explanations: Organizational: Nestlé as a company making decisions about their product formulations and setting nutrition commitments.; Environmental and Societal: Public health authorities providing recommendations and the broader societal context of non-communicable diseases.
claude3.7: Summary: [Environmental and Societal <-> Organizational] Public health authorities influence Nestlé's product formulation decisions, while Nestlé's healthier products aim to contribute to reducing non-communicable diseases in society.
4o: Scale Explanations: Organizational: Nestlé, as a company, is making changes to its product formulations.; Environmental and Societal: The changes are aimed at addressing public health concerns and non-communicable diseases in society.
4o: Summary: [Organizational -> Environmental and Societal] Nestlé's product reformulations aim to improve public health by reducing non-communicable diseases.
o4_mini: Scale Explanations: Organizational: The company is implementing changes in its product formulations.; Environmental and Societal: The changes are aimed at improving public health and addressing non-communicable diseases in society.
o4_mini: Summary: [Organizational -> Environmental and Societal] The company's reformulation of products to reduce unhealthy ingredients contributes to public health improvements.
gemini2.5: Scale Explanations: Environmental and Societal: The text references 'public health authorities' recommendations and the 'fight against non-communicable diseases in society,' representing governmental or broad societal systems and challenges.; Organizational: The actions of 'we' (implied Nestlé, a single company) regarding product formulation, reduction targets, and public commitments fall under a single organization's activities.; Individual: The focus on 'children and teenagers' as consumers whose health is impacted by product changes refers to specific individuals or informal groups.
gemini2.5: Summary: [Environmental and Societal <-> Organizational -> Individual] Societal health recommendations and the fight against non-communicable diseases influence an organization's product reformulation and public commitments, which in turn contribute to societal health and directly impact the health of individual consumers like children and teenagers.

Full Paragraph Text: We want to help people who buy our products to make informed decisions by giving them better nutritional information on our product labels. We are enhancing our portion guidance and have committed to print GDAs (Guideline Daily Amounts) on the front of all relevant packaging. These make it easier for people to see how much salt, sugar or fat is in the product, and how the amounts compare to reference daily guidelines. Nestlé Portion Guidance is a voluntary initiative
claude3.7: Scale Explanations: Organizational: Nestlé (implied as 'we') is implementing a labeling initiative with GDAs and portion guidance on their packaging.; Individual: Consumers ('people who buy our products') who will use the nutritional information to make informed purchasing decisions.
claude3.7: Summary: [Organizational -> Individual] Nestlé's enhanced nutritional labeling initiative with GDAs and portion guidance directly influences individual consumers' ability to make informed food purchasing decisions.
4o: Scale Explanations: Organizational: Nestlé, as a company, is implementing changes to its product labels.; Individual: Consumers who buy Nestlé products are the ones making informed decisions based on the new labels.
4o: Summary: [Organizational -> Individual] Nestlé's initiative to enhance product labels directly helps consumers make informed nutritional choices.
o4_mini: Scale Explanations: Organizational: Nestlé is implementing changes to its product labels to provide better nutritional information.; Individual: Consumers will benefit from improved nutritional information, aiding their decision-making.; Environmental and Societal: The initiative contributes to public health by promoting better dietary choices.
o4_mini: Summary: [Organizational -> Individual -> Environmental and Societal] Nestlé's initiative to enhance product labels aims to empower consumers with better nutritional information, ultimately benefiting public health.
gemini2.5: Scale Explanations: Environmental and Societal: 'reference daily guidelines' represent standards or recommendations set at a broader societal or governmental level for public health.; Organizational: The entity 'We' or 'Nestlé' refers to a single company taking action (enhancing portion guidance, printing GDAs).; Individual: 'people who buy our products' refers to specific consumers making decisions based on the provided information.
gemini2.5: Summary: [Environmental and Societal -> Organizational -> Individual] Societal reference daily guidelines influence an organization's decision to provide nutritional information, which in turn helps individuals make informed purchasing decisions.

Full Paragraph Text: In parts of the world where people find it difficult to get essential vitamins and minerals in their daily diets, we fortify foods to help them and their families stay healthy. We are on track to deliver our commitment of 200 billion servings of micronutrient fortified foods and beverages annually around the world by next year. In 2014 we continued to extend the reach of our microfortification programmes, focusing on categories for children and women of child-bearing age, such as fortified infant cereals and growing-up milks.

Full Paragraph Text: The importance of the right nutrition and feeding practices during the first 1000 days of life, from conception to a child’s second birthday, is now widely accepted by the public health community. Our Start Healthy Stay Healthy programme is dedicated to supporting mothers and caregivers to get nu trition right in the first 1000 days. Good nutrition is crucial for health, growth and development, and establishing the right feeding practices in early childhood also supports the establishment of good eating habits.

Full Paragraph Text: We promote and support breastfeeding which is the best start a baby can have in life. Where breastfeeding is not possible, we provide breast-milk substitutes. In addition, we have developed science-based nutritional solutions for infants with specific medical needs, who are unable to absorb, digest or metabolise standard infant formulas and are at risk of death or abnormal development without access to these products.

Our marketing standards are the strictest in the industry. We are the only breast-milk substitute manufacturer to be included in the FTSE4Good responsible investment index (see the Nestlé in society report).

Full Paragraph Text: In the Nestlé in society report we detail our progress towards meeting our 38 Creating Shared Value commitments (including three new ones for 2014). These commitments, which we introduced in 2013, make it possible for stakeholders to hold us accountable, while at the same time encouraging our management, and all our employees, to achieve continuous improvement. Creating Shared Value requires compliance with the highest standards of business practice, including international codes and standards as well as our own.

Full Paragraph Text: The Nespresso AAA Sustainable Quality Programme, developed with the Rainforest Alliance, was launched in 2003. Nespresso pays above-market prices for its coffee beans, as part of its commitment in the programme.

Full Paragraph Text: For the Nestlé Needs YOUth programme in Europe, where one in four people under the age of 25 is unemployed, we pledged to offer 20000 jobs, apprenticeships and traineeships over three years, and establish readiness for work activities across our operations. Full Paragraph Text: We built on the success of this initiative in 2014 by establishing the Alliance for YOUth, a collaboration with around 200 other companies, to scale up and coordinate our efforts to tackle youth unemployment. The efforts of the Alliance for YOUth will result in the creation of more than 100000 opportunities for young people in Europe.

Full Paragraph Text: By 2020, one billion people in the world will be over 60, in creasing the burden on society from obesity and chronic diseases. It is estimated global healthcare costs could rise to between USD 5–10 trillion by the end of the decade. At the same time scientific understanding of health, disease and the potential of nutrition is growing.

Full Paragraph Text: Nestlé Health Science aims to champion the role of nutritional therapies that have proven clinical and health economic value, and improve the quality of people’s lives. The company focuses on three areas: Consumer Care, which aims to address specific health conditions with an emphasis on enhancing ‘healthy ageing’; Medical Nutrition, which supplies hospitals and other healthcare facilities; and Novel Therapeutic nutrition, which works on new nutritional therapies (including pre scribed medicines) for specific diseases and conditions that would be administered by a health professional.
claude3.7: Summary: N/A
4o: Scale Explanations: Organizational: Nestlé Health Science is a company focusing on nutritional therapies.; Environmental and Societal: The company's efforts aim to improve the quality of people's lives, impacting societal health systems.

gemini2.5: Summary: [Organizational -> Individual] Nestlé Health Science, an organizational entity, develops therapies and products designed to improve the quality of life for individuals and be administered by individual health professionals.

Full Paragraph Text: Nestlé Health Science is supported in its work by the Nestlé Institute of Health Sciences (NIHS) which under takes fundamental scientific research into how nutrition can be used to empower people to improve and maintain their health. NIHS research teams are providing greater insight into how our environment, diet and lifestyle intersect with our genetic make-up, gut microorganisms, metabolism and nutritional status to determine our health.

gemini2.5: Summary: [Organizational -> [Environmental and Societal, Individual] -> Individual] The Organizational entity (NIHS) conducts research providing insight into how Environmental and Societal factors and Individual characteristics converge to determine Individual health, using this understanding to empower individuals.

Full Paragraph Text: NIHS has established the first complete essential nutrient profiling platform for accurate analysis of nutrient status. Thanks to the development of digital applications that capture dietary intake, the institute can now combine the information about the nutritional content of diet with measurements in people’s blood. This research offers the prospect of developing personalised nutrition products, including dietary recommendations.

gemini2.5: Summary: [Organizational <-> Individual] NIHS, an organizational entity, develops a platform that both collects data from individuals and, in turn, offers personalized nutrition products and recommendations to them.

Full Paragraph Text: Nestlé’s Jian Xin Double Care, a specially designed milk to enhance heart and bone health for middle-aged and senior adults, was launched in China in December 2013. The product contains phytosterols, which lower LDL (‘bad’) cholesterol, as well as calcium and vitamin D. The brand raises awareness of heart health with in-store health checks and offers toll-free phone contact with doctors to discuss cardiovascular health.

Full Paragraph Text: Nestlé Fitness biscuits are wholegrain cereal-based snacks low in fat and calories. After just three years, Nestlé Fitness biscuits hold the number one position in Brazil’s healthy biscuit segment. The biscuits are sold across South America and in Israel.

Full Paragraph Text: In 2014, we transformed a dairy factory in Mexico into the company’s first ‘zero water’ manufacturing site in the world. Cow’s milk is 88% water, so by extracting some of it to use in the factory’s systems, we are saving enough water to meet the average daily consumption of 6400 people in the surrounding area.
claude3.7: Scale Explanations: Organizational: The company/factory that implemented the 'zero water' manufacturing process represents the organizational scale.; Environmental and Societal: The surrounding community/area that benefits from the water savings represents the environmental and societal scale.
claude3.7: Summary: [Organizational -> Environmental and Societal] A company's implementation of 'zero water' manufacturing at its dairy factory directly benefits the surrounding community by saving water equivalent to the daily consumption of 6400 people.
4o: Scale Explanations: Organizational: The transformation of the dairy factory into a 'zero water' manufacturing site is an organizational initiative.; Environmental and Societal: The water savings impact the surrounding community by meeting the average daily consumption needs of 6400 people.
4o: Summary: [Organizational -> Environmental and Societal] The dairy factory's transformation into a 'zero water' site directly benefits the local community by saving water equivalent to the daily needs of 6400 people.
o4_mini: Scale Explanations: Organizational: The dairy factory represents a specific organization implementing water-saving technologies.; Environmental and Societal: The water savings benefit the surrounding community, impacting societal water consumption.
o4_mini: Summary: [Organizational -> Environmental and Societal] The dairy factory's zero water initiative significantly reduces water usage, benefiting the local community's water supply.
gemini2.5: Scale Explanations: Organizational: The 'company' (implied by 'we') and its 'dairy factory' represent a single organization and its specific unit/site.; Environmental and Societal: The impact of saving water for '6400 people in the surrounding area' and the 'natural systems' (water resources) they depend on falls under the societal and environmental scale.
gemini2.5: Summary: [Organizational -> Environmental and Societal] A company's dairy factory transformation into a 'zero water' site directly saves water for the surrounding community.

Full Paragraph Text: The new technology used at the factory in Jalisco, Mexico, heats milk at low pressure to remove some of the water. The resulting steam is then condensed and treated and used to clean machines. It is then recycled and used again. The process reduces by 15% the total amount of water used by Nestlé Mexico. Work is now underway to deploy similar tech nology in five other manufacturing sites in water stressed are as around the world. It is just one of a number of water-saving initiatives we have introduced in recent years, allowing us to reduce total water withdrawal in absolute terms by almost one third in the last decade.
claude3.7: Scale Explanations: Organizational: Nestlé Mexico as a single company implementing water-saving technology at their factory in Jalisco, and planning to deploy similar technology at other manufacturing sites.; Environmental and Societal: The water resources being conserved represent an environmental scale, particularly in 'water stressed areas around the world' which indicates environmental impact.
claude3.7: Summary: [Organizational -> Environmental and Societal] Nestlé Mexico's implementation of water recycling technology reduces water withdrawal from the environment by 15% at the factory level and by almost one-third across the company over the last decade.
4o: Scale Explanations: Organizational: Nestlé Mexico and its manufacturing sites are specific organizations implementing the technology.; Environmental and Societal: The reduction in water usage impacts societal-level systems, particularly in water-stressed areas.
4o: Summary: [Organizational -> Environmental and Societal] Nestlé Mexico's new water-saving technology reduces water usage, benefiting water-stressed areas.
o4_mini: Scale Explanations: Organizational: Nestlé Mexico is implementing new technology to improve water efficiency in its operations.; Environmental and Societal: The reduction in water usage contributes to broader environmental sustainability efforts and addresses water stress in various regions.
o4_mini: Summary: [Organizational -> Environmental and Societal] Nestlé Mexico's new technology reduces water usage, contributing to global water sustainability efforts.
gemini2.5: Scale Explanations: Organizational: Nestlé Mexico, as a single company, is the actor implementing new technology and water-saving initiatives across its manufacturing sites.; Environmental and Societal: The direct impact of Nestlé's actions is a reduction in water usage, affecting natural water systems and addressing concerns in 'water stressed areas' globally.
gemini2.5: Summary: [Organizational -> Environmental and Societal] Nestlé Mexico's implementation of new water-saving technology and initiatives directly reduces its water withdrawal, benefiting environmental water resources.

Full Paragraph Text: Today our people are carrying out 170 water-saving projects in Nestlé factories, which will save around 3.6 million cubic metres of water.

Full Paragraph Text: In March 2014, we opened the Nestlé Food Safety Institute in Beijing, China. The new centre has three objectives: to collaborate with Chinese universities, research institutes and regulatory authorities in food safety research; to increase our ability to assess risks, anticipate problems and provide accurate information in any food safety situations; and to engage on scientific communication and food safety training.

claude3.7: Summary: [Organizational <-> Environmental and Societal] Nestlé's Food Safety Institute establishes a bidirectional relationship with Chinese regulatory authorities, where Nestlé provides food safety research and training while receiving regulatory guidance and legitimacy.

4o: Summary: [Organizational, Inter-Organizational / Sector] -> Environmental and Societal] Nestlé's collaboration with Chinese institutions aims to enhance food safety at a societal level.

Full Paragraph Text: Nestlé is deeply integrated into people’s lives with many buying our products on a daily basis. This gives us opportunities to contribute meaningfully to their quality of life. It is what our promise of Good Food, Good Life is all about: offering the best tasting, healthiest choices across a wide range of food and beverages, from morning to night and throughout life, helping people to live more enjoyable, healthy lives.

Full Paragraph Text: However, today, even brands that enjoy a high level of loyalty and trust need attention grabbing, engaging consumer communication to ensure they remain relevant to consumers. Therefore, excellence in brand building discipline and conviction about the importance of strong, sustainable brand equity is more important than ever, especially in an increasingly complex and crowded digital world.

gemini2.5: Summary: [Environmental and Societal -> Organizational -> Individual] The complex and crowded digital world necessitates brands (organizational) to engage in effective consumer communication to remain relevant to individual consumers.

Full Paragraph Text: The successful roll-out of Maggi Oats Noodles demonstrated that healthy eating can be both enjoyable and tasty. Strong sales of the new product show that it is also good business. Maggi Oats Noodles meet Nestlé Nutritional Foundation criteria, which are based on public health recommendations. The consumer communication reinforces the importance for families to start the day with a well-balanced breakfast, including fruits and milk. In 2014, we continued to renovate Maggi products all around the world, reducing salt and fat and improving their nutritional benefits.
claude3.7: Scale Explanations: Organizational: Nestlé as a company making decisions about Maggi products, including product development, renovation, and communication strategies.; Individual: Consumers/families who purchase and consume Maggi Oats Noodles, influenced by the product and its messaging.; Environmental and Societal: Public health recommendations that inform Nestlé Nutritional Foundation criteria.
claude3.7: Summary: [Environmental and Societal -> Organizational -> Individual] Public health recommendations inform Nestlé's nutritional criteria, which shapes their product development and messaging that ultimately influences consumer eating behaviors and family breakfast habits.
4o: Scale Explanations: Individual: Consumers and families are influenced by the product and its marketing.; Organizational: Nestlé, as the organization, is responsible for the product development and marketing.; Environmental and Societal: The product aligns with public health recommendations, impacting societal health norms.
4o: Summary: [Organizational -> Individual -> Environmental and Societal] Nestlé's development and marketing of Maggi Oats Noodles influence consumer habits and align with public health recommendations.
o4_mini: Scale Explanations: Individual: Consumers are influenced by the healthy eating message and choose to buy Maggi Oats Noodles.; Organizational: Nestlé, as the organization behind Maggi, develops products that align with nutritional guidelines and consumer preferences.; Environmental and Societal: The product's alignment with public health recommendations reflects broader societal health goals.
o4_mini: Summary: [Environmental and Societal -> Organizational -> Individual] Public health recommendations influence Nestlé to create healthier products, which in turn attract consumers.
gemini2.5: Scale Explanations: Environmental and Societal: The text mentions 'public health recommendations,' which are societal-level guidelines influencing corporate actions.; Organizational: Nestlé is a specific organization, and 'Maggi Oats Noodles,' 'Nestlé Nutritional Foundation criteria,' 'consumer communication,' and product renovation ('reducing salt and fat') are all activities or entities at the organizational level.; Individual: 'Families' and 'consumers' are specific individuals or informal groups targeted by communication and whose 'strong sales' demonstrate their purchasing behavior.
gemini2.5: Summary: [Environmental and Societal -> Organizational <-> Individual] Public health recommendations influence Nestlé's product development and communication aimed at families, whose subsequent purchasing behavior contributes to the product's business success.

Full Paragraph Text: The Maggi company began selling powdered soups in Switzerland in 1885. Julius Maggi had pioneered the production of pea and bean soups at the request of the Swiss Public Welfare Society to address the dietary deficiency of the work ing population. The advent of factory work for women meant less time to prepare food, and the soups were a convenient and nourishing alternative.
claude3.7: Scale Explanations: Environmental and Societal: The Swiss Public Welfare Society represents a societal-level entity concerned with public health and nutrition.; Organizational: The Maggi company is a clear organizational entity that developed and sold powdered soups.; Individual: Working population, specifically women factory workers who had less time to prepare food.
claude3.7: Summary: [Environmental and Societal -> Organizational -> Individual] The Swiss Public Welfare Society requested Julius Maggi's company to develop powdered soups, which then provided convenient nutrition to working women who had less time for food preparation due to factory work.
4o: Scale Explanations: Organizational: Maggi company is an organization that produced and sold powdered soups.; Environmental and Societal: The Swiss Public Welfare Society represents societal-level systems addressing public health and dietary needs.
4o: Summary: [Environmental and Societal -> Organizational] The Swiss Public Welfare Society's request led Maggi to produce soups to address dietary deficiencies.
o4_mini: Scale Explanations: Individual: The working population, particularly women, who needed convenient food options.; Organizational: The Maggi company, which produced and sold the soups.; Environmental and Societal: The societal context of dietary deficiencies and the changing roles of women in the workforce.
o4_mini: Summary: [Environmental and Societal -> Organizational -> Individual] The dietary needs of the working population led Maggi to create convenient soups, benefiting individual consumers.
gemini2.5: Causal Pathway: Environmental and Societal -> Individual -> Organizational -> Individual
gemini2.5: Scale Explanations: Environmental and Societal: The 'advent of factory work for women' represents a large-scale societal and economic shift impacting daily life and structure.; Individual: The 'working population' and 'women' are specific individuals or informal groups experiencing dietary deficiency and later benefiting from the convenient soups.; Organizational: The 'Maggi company' is a specific single organization producing the soups, and the 'Swiss Public Welfare Society' is a specific formal group/organization making a request.
gemini2.5: Summary: [Environmental and Societal -> Individual -> Organizational -> Individual] The societal shift of factory work caused dietary deficiencies for individuals, which prompted an organizational response from the Swiss Public Welfare Society and Maggi company, ultimately providing a beneficial solution for the working population.

Full Paragraph Text: Last year, Maggi created a new breakfast option for the Indian market, Maggi Oats Noodles, offering Nutrition, Health and Wellness in a bowl. The noodles are made from 51% wholegrain oat flour, fibre (equivalent to one bowl of oats), with a real vegetable garnish, as well as the popular authentic masala taste.

Full Paragraph Text: Parents want their children to make the most of their potential. Nestlé Milo, which is mainly consumed by children aged 7–12, can help to provide the nourishing energy they need to succeed. Activ-Go plays a role in energy release, muscle function, bone maintenance and red blood cell formation, all essential for physical activity.

Full Paragraph Text: Nestlé Milo celebrated its 80th birthday in 2014. It was created by Nestlé engineer Thomas Mayne to help children who had poor diets get sufficient nutrition. He created Nestlé Milo from malt, milk and cocoa to give children the nutritious energy they need to get the best out of their day. It was launched at the Sydney Easter Show in 1934.
claude3.7: Scale Explanations: Individual: Thomas Mayne, the Nestlé engineer who created Milo; Organizational: Nestlé as a company that produced and launched Milo; Environmental and Societal: Children with poor diets, representing a societal nutritional issue
claude3.7: Summary: [Environmental and Societal -> Individual -> Organizational] A societal problem (children's poor nutrition) motivated an individual engineer (Thomas Mayne) to create a product that was then produced and launched by an organization (Nestlé).
4o: Summary: N/A
o4_mini: Summary: N/A

gemini2.5: Summary: [Individual -> Organizational -> Environmental and Societal] An individual Nestlé engineer created Milo as an organizational product, which was intended to address the societal issue of poor nutrition among children.

Full Paragraph Text: Nestlé Milo has been a staunch supporter of youth sports throughout its history, and has fuelled generations through their formative years.

Full Paragraph Text: In 2014 Nestlé’s organic growth was 4.5%, composed of 2.3% real internal growth and 2.2% pricing. Sales were CHF 91.6 billion, down 0.6%, impacted by negative foreign exchange of –5.5%. Acquisitions, net of divestitures, added 0.4% to sales.
claude3.7: Summary: N/A
4o: Summary: N/A
o4_mini: Summary: N/A

gemini2.5: Summary: [Environmental and Societal -> Organizational] Negative foreign exchange, a component of the environmental and societal scale, directly impacted Nestlé's organizational sales.

Full Paragraph Text: The Group’s trading operating profit was CHF 14.0 billion, representing a margin of 15.3%, up 10 basis points, and up 30 basis points in constant currencies. The cost of goods sold fell by 30 basis points as a percentage of sales, driven by product mix and pricing actions and savings created by Nestlé Continuous Excellence which more than offset increases in raw material costs. Distribution costs were up by 10 basis points. Total marketing and administration expenses rose by 10 basis points as we increased consumer facing marketing support for our brands.
claude3.7: Summary: N/A

gemini2.5: Summary: [Environmental and Societal -> Organizational, Organizational -> Individual] Nestlé's organizational efficiency efforts offset rising raw material costs, while its increased marketing expenses were directed at individual consumers.

Full Paragraph Text: The Zone’s organic growth was supported by double-digit growth for Nescafé Dolce Gusto and strong performances in ambient dairy and petcare. In North America growth improved towards the end of the year while in Latin America good growth was helped by pricing, reflecting inflationary pressures.

Full Paragraph Text: Our performance in North America was affected by the frozen category. Projects are underway to reposition Lean Cuisine, Hot Pockets and Stouffers. They address all elements of the marketing mix, reflecting trends such as organic and ethnic, enhancing the brands’ relevance to consumers. We are taking the same approach in frozen pizza where our California Pizza Kitchen did well. In ice cream the super premium segment performed well with Gelato, and snacks returned to growth, although the premium segment was subdued. In confectionery the successful roll-out of Butterfinger Peanut Butter Cups continued. Innovations like Natural Bliss and seasonal renovations of flavours helped Coffee-mate de liver good growth. Innovation also ensured the petcare busi ness in North America continued to grow with Dog Chow, Pro Plan and Tidy Cats Lightweight cat litter as highlights. The launch of Beyond natural pet food gained momentum.
Scale Disagreement: Environmental and Societal, Individual, Inter-Organizational / Sector
claude3.7: Summary: N/A

gemini2.5: Summary: [Environmental and Societal -> Organizational -> Individual -> Organizational] Societal trends and market conditions affect an organization's performance and prompt strategic responses, which in turn influence individual consumers whose purchasing behavior then drives the organization's growth.

Full Paragraph Text: Latin America delivered good organic growth despite a worsening of the macroeconomic situation towards the end of the year. Although consumer sentiment varied across the region, most markets did well. All Brazil’s categories grew, with Ninho in growing-up milks, KitKat in confectionery, Nesfit in biscuits and Nescau in cocoa and malt beverages making strong contributions. In Mexico the changes in fiscal legislation, pricing and subdued consumer demand affect ed the market. Nescafé Dolce Gusto delivered double-digit growth across the region, while Dog Chow and Pro Plan drove sales in the petcare business.
claude3.7: Scale Explanations: Environmental and Societal: Macroeconomic situation in Latin America, changes in fiscal legislation in Mexico, and broader consumer sentiment across the region represent societal-level factors.; Organizational: Nestlé as a company and its specific brands (Ninho, KitKat, Nesfit, Nescau, Nescafé Dolce Gusto, Dog Chow, Pro Plan) represent the organizational scale.
claude3.7: Summary: [Environmental and Societal -> Organizational] Macroeconomic conditions and fiscal legislation changes in Latin America directly affected Nestlé's organizational performance across its various product lines.
4o: Scale Explanations: Organizational: Companies like Ninho, KitKat, Nesfit, Nescau, Nescafé Dolce Gusto, Dog Chow, and Pro Plan are specific brands or product lines within organizations.; Environmental and Societal: The macroeconomic situation, consumer sentiment, and fiscal legislation changes are societal-level factors.
4o: Summary: [Organizational, Environmental and Societal] -> Organizational] Organizational growth in Latin America was influenced by both strong brand performance and macroeconomic conditions.

Full Paragraph Text: Relative to the market this was good growth, driven by innovation and premiumisation. The European trading en vironment continued to be volatile and intense, with defla tionary pressure increasing during the year and consumer confidence very fragile, reducing the flexibility to price.

Full Paragraph Text: Good performances in France, Switzerland, Austria and the Netherlands, and a recovery in Spain and Portugal sup ported the growth in Western Europe. The Great Britain region, Germany, Italy and Greece were more challenged. There were strong performances from petcare and Nescafé Dolce Gusto across Western Europe and we saw good growth from innovations in several categories. Highlights included Nescafé Gold and Azzera premium soluble coffee, Fresh Up and Buitoni Fiesta in frozen pizza, Maggi snacking noodles in ambient culinary and the launch of premium chocolate tablets Les Recettes de l’Atelier in France.

gemini2.5: Summary: [Organizational -> Environmental and Societal] Good performances from product categories and growth from innovations within an organization supported the overall growth and recovery in various Western European countries and regions.

Full Paragraph Text: The slower growth in the Zone was due to our largest market China and to Oceania. In China we needed to adapt our portfolio to reconnect with the fast-changing expectations of the Chinese consumer. Therefore, in addition to correcting trade stocks throughout the year, we focused on innovation, on reformulation and on re-launches, particularly in coffee, ready-to-drink and confectionery. We continued to see good performances in ambient culinary, ice cream and ready-to drink coffee. In Oceania we are focused on developing new trade channels.
Scale Disagreement: Environmental and Societal, Individual, Inter-Organizational / Sector
claude3.7: Scale Explanations: Individual: Chinese consumers with changing expectations represent the individual scale.; Organizational: The company (implied to be a food/beverage corporation) making strategic adaptations to its portfolio represents the organizational scale.
claude3.7: Summary: [Individual <-> Organizational] Chinese consumers' changing expectations prompted the company to adapt its product portfolio through innovation and reformulation, while the company simultaneously attempts to influence consumer behavior through these product changes.
